text: The Myanma Foreign Trade Bank (; abbreviated MFTB) is a state-owned bank specializing in foreign banking. Its provides trade finance and foreign exchange-related banking to the government, state enterprises, and the international community residing in Myanmar. MFTB also manages Burma's official foreign currency reserves. Until recent economic reforms, MFTB had a monopoly on foreign exchange and customer base. The bank was established under the Financial Institutions of Myanmar Law of 1990. ==References== Category:Banks of Myanmar Category:Banks established in 1990 Category:1990 establishments in Myanmar Category:Yangon
title: Myanma Foreign Trade Bank
